title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 153.8 - Abandoned property
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 153.8 - Abandoned property

State Regulations

In the event that any property of any name or nature stored
is left at any canal terminal or in any storehouse connected therewith beyond
the period authorized, or in the event the owner of property abandons same at a
canal terminal, the Canal Corporation may notify the owner of such left or
abandoned property, if the name and address of such owner be known, and direct
that it be removed. But if the name and address of such owner be not known or
if the owner fails to comply promptly with the notice of removal, the Canal

Corporation may cause such property to be removed from the canal terminal site. If the name of the owner is known, such removal shall be at the owner's risk, cost and expense. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
153.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
